thread.title: 10 Questions We Have About Mo Farah’s New Knighthood
thread.title_full: 10 Questions We Have About Mo Farah’s New Knighthood

author: Chris Michel
title: 10 Questions We Have About Mo Farah’s New Knighthood
text:
Newswire Fun 10 Questions We Have About Mo Farah’s New Knighthood We’re a little unclear on what this means for the running legend, so we put together a brief list of queries. By Kit Fox , Christopher Michel Friday, January 6, 2017, 4:04 pm Sir Mo Farah poses for photographs in Holyrood Park prior to the Great Edinburgh X Country on January 6, 2017 in Edinburgh, Scotland. Ian MacNicol / Getty 
After Mo Farah’s historic gold medal performance in both the 5,000 and 10,000 meters at the 2016 Olympics , the British runner—along with tennis star Andy Murray and heptathlete Jessica Ennis-Hill—was named to the “New Year’s Honours List” on December 31, by Her Majesty the Queen of England. What that means, apparently, was that Farah was officially knighted. 
Since Americans don’t have any traditions resembling this, we have a few questions for Sir Farah: Advertisement 
1. Did they do the thing with the sword , and was it sharp? 
2. How will you run in the full suit of armor? 
3. Do you get to compete in races while mounted on a horse? 
4. Is everyone you pass in a race required to kneel and swear fealty? 
5. Are you in the market for a squire—how does one apply? 
6. Where do we register for the Camelot Marathon? 
7. When do you start officially hunting for the Grail? 
8. Did Sir Paul McCartney teach you the secret handshake? 
9. Did you immediately shave the corners off your table, or do they have a specially-made round one they just give you? 
10. Will you now have to compete in this? 
The man who is surely Britain’s speediest knight will be competing at the Great Edinburgh International Cross Country 8K on Saturday, where he will try to reclaim the top spot from Garrett Heath .
